summary:
Jerry Tjon has a BSc. degree in Information Technology (2002) from the Hogeschool van Amsterdam (HvA) and a MSc. degree in Political Science (2011) from the Universiteit van Amsterdam (UvA). 

His MA thesis “Development and the Post Conflict State: A Comparative Case study of Burundi and Rwanda” made quite an impact; it was nominated for the IKV PAX Christi Thesis Award 2011; was published at the specialist library of African Studies Center Leiden (ASCL); and led to several speaking engagements on the subject of state development and post conflict conditions throughout the Netherlands. His academic interests are: International Relations, Security, Conflict, Development and Africa.

Tjon's BSc. degree is in the field of embedded software engineering. His undergraduate project dealt with the redesign of a dental utility system; moving the functionality of “analogue” hardware towards software driven and CPU controlled hardware.

Specialties Political Science: 
IR theories, Conflict, Security, State Development, Quantitative Analysis, SPSS, Qualitative Analysis.

Specialties IT, Architecture and Software Development:
MSP5, TOGAF 9, ArchiMate 3, Digital Practitioner Book of Knowledge (DPBoK), IT4IT, Azure, Cloud computing, Enterprise, Solution & Application Architecture, UML, RUP, .Net, C#, Patterns and Practices, Service Oriented Architecture, Agile, Scrum, ASL, PRINCE 2.
